parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary verb; to 'know' in a great variety of applications and with many implications.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From para and echo; to hold near, i.e. Present, afford, exhibit, furnish occasion.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A woman, wife, my lady. Probably from the base of ginomai; a woman; specially, a wife.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To work, trade, perform, do, practice, commit, acquire by labor.
Properly, beautiful, but chiefly good, i.e. Valuable or virtuous.
From a primary ergo; toil; by implication, an act.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
